column9: The "212" of Brazil. The economic engine. "011" implies hustle business and traffic. Lots of traffic.
The Aviation hub (Embraer HQ) and the pilgrimage center (Aparecida).
The port city and the weekend beach getaway for Paulistanos.
Known for the "Bauru" sandwich and vast university towns.
Major industrial hub close to the capital.
The "California of Brazil." Wealthy agribusiness region (coffee/sugar cane).
Home of the biggest Rodeo in Latin America (Barretos).
The "Silicon Valley of Brazil" (Unicamp University). Wealthy tech corridor.
The "Hollywood" code. Copacabana, Beach, Sugar loaf and Christ the Redeemer.
The "Hamptons" of Rio. Where the wealthy go for holidays (Búzios).
Imperial City (Petrópolis) and luxury islands (Angra).
The coastal capital. A bridge between the Southeast and Northeast cultures.
Birthplace of Roberto Carlos (the "King" of Brazilian music).
The land of Pão de Queijo. Famous for hospitality and mining wealth.
Culturally very close to Rio de Janeiro.
Historically known for high emigration to the USA (Boston area).
Rich agribusiness region; culturally closer to Goiás/Sertanejo style.
Coffee country and hot springs.
Clothing manufacturing hub.
Transition zone to the arid Northeast (Sertão).
Famous for urban planning and cold weather. The "Europe" of Brazil.
Soybean farming and Slavic immigration history.
Originally settled by the British; coffee history.
Planned cities and agribusiness.
Home to the Iguazu Falls and the border with Paraguay/Argentina.
German heritage (Oktoberfest) and the "Brazilian Dubai" (Camboriú skyscrapers).
Magic Island. A major tech hub and surf capital.
Agribusiness powerhouse.
The heart of Gaúcho (cowboy) culture and "Churrasco" (BBQ). Includes the Gramado tourist alps.
Historic charque (dried meat) region; very cold in winter.
Italian wine country. The "Napa Valley" of Brazil.
University towns and vast soy fields.
The Political Capital. Designed by Niemeyer. Distinct "rock band" scene (Legião Urbana).
The Capital of Sertanejo Music (Brazil's Country Music).
The newest state in Brazil (created in 1988). The agricultural frontier.
Gateway to the Pantanal wetlands and massive soy production.
The absolute heart of global soy farming.
Home to Bonito (eco-tourism capital).
Remote Amazonian state; borders Peru/Bolivia.
Major agricultural frontier in the Amazon basin.
The heart of Afro-Brazilian culture.  Axé music and Carnival
Cocoa coast and the site where Portuguese first arrived in 1500.
Major commercial crossroads of the Northeast.
New agricultural frontier (cotton/soy) in the Cerrado.
The smallest state in Brazil.
"Porto Digital" (tech hub) and Frevo culture.
Known as the "Brazilian Caribbean" due to the water color.
Home to the "Largest São João Festival in the World."
Famous for sand dunes and buggy rides.
Humor capital of Brazil (famous comedians) and windsurfing mecca.
Teresina is the only Northeast capital not on the ocean.
Religious pilgrimage site (Padre Cícero).
Gateway to the Amazon River. Famous for Açaí and Tacacá food.
Operates on a different time zone (-1hr). Industrial Free Zone in the jungle.
The northernmost state; borders Venezuela.
The only state capital that the Equator line runs directly through.
Deep Amazon; distinct code for the remote river regions.
Unique reggae culture ("Brazilian Jamaica") and sand dunes.
